info.description:
PyLit
-----

   The idea is that you do not document programs (after the fact), but
   write documents that *contain* the programs.
   
   -- John Max Skaller in a `Charming Python interview`_


PyLit (Python Literate) provides a plain but efficient tool for `literate
programming`: a bidirectional text/code converter. 

Features
--------

* `Dual Source`
* Markup with reStructuredText_
* Code in any language
* Python Doctest Support

.. _Charming Python interview:
    http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/library/l-pyth7.html
.. _reStructuredText: http://docutils.sourceforge.net/rst.html

PyLit

The idea is that you do not document programs (after the fact), but write documents that contain the programs.

—John Max Skaller in a Charming Python interview

PyLit (Python Literate) provides a plain but efficient tool for literate programming: a bidirectional text/code converter.

Features
